document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: The South American genus Nigranitida Metz (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the description of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The South American genus Nigranitida Metz (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the description of three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Like
Nigranitida gibba
and
N. irwini
in lacking setae on the katepisternum. It differs from
N . gibba
and
N. irwini
by having the halter and maxillary palpus dark brown, the setae on the male mesonotum white; and the female wing veins with a dark brown margin. It is separated from the female of
N. irwini
by having the frons dark reddish brown, glossy with a small area of gray pruinescence ventrolaterally and covering the ocellar tubercle (female of
N. gibba
is unknown).

Head. Length 0.70–0.88 , 0.79 mm . Frons pruinescence silver gray, black dorsally. Antenna black, Ant/HL 0.67–0.76 , 0.71 ; scape length 0.16–0.20 , 0.18 mm , length/width 1.6–1.8 , 1.7 , scape/pedicel length 1.6 –2.0, 1.8 , scape/flagellum width 0.83–0.86 , 0.84 , setae dark reddish brown, white ventrally, elongate; pedicel length 0.08–0.11 , 0.10 mm , length/width 0.83–1.10 , 0.91 ; flagellum length 0.30–0.36 , 0.33 mm , length/width 2.5–2.8 , 2.6 , flagellum/scape length 1.8–1.9 , 1.8 . Parafacial pruinescence silver gray. Maxillary palpus dark brown; length 0.28–0.40 , 0.36 mm , length/width 4.7 –6.0, 5.1 ; setae pale yellow. Genal setae white. Occipital setae white becoming appressed, lanceolate dorsolaterally; macrosetae dark reddish brown, scattered.

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 1 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, 1–2 sc. Mesonotum dark reddish brown, pruinescence light gray; vitta indistinct; setae black, erect, elongate intermixed with white, appressed setae. Pleuron dark reddish brown, pruinescence white, dense; setae white on propleuron, anepisternum, laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum, absent on katepisternum. Wing. Length 3.7–4.5 , 4.2 mm , length/width 2.7–2.9 , 2.8 ; membrane opaque; veins brown; pterostigma dark brown. Halter dark brown. Legs. Femora dark brown, pruinescence white; setae white, elongate ventrally on fore­ and midfemora; av 2– 5 : 1 : 4–5 , pv 0:0: 1–3 . Fore­ and hindtibiae dark brown, midtibia dark yellowish brown, apex dark brown. Tarsi dark brown.
Similar to male except for following.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–10.
Nigranitida costata
1. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci, hypoproct, dorsal view (MEI 048204). 2. Sternite 8, hypandrium, gonocoxite, ventral view. 3. Gonocoxite, hypandrium, dorsal view. 4. Gonocoxite, left lateral view. 5. Gonostylus, left lateral view. 6. Aedeagus, dorsal view (inset: ejaculatory apodeme cross­section). 7. Aedeagus, ventral view. 8. Aedeagus, left lateral view. 9. Female head. 10. Female internal reproductive organs (MEI 106765). Scale = 0.1 mm. Abbreviations: C = cercus, CD = common duct, DA=dorsal apodeme, Dp = distiphallus, EA = ejaculatory apodeme, Ep a= epandrium, F = furca, GA = gonocoxal apodeme, Gs = gonostylus, Gx = gonocoxite, GxB = gonocoxal bridge, H = hypandrium, Hp = hypoproct, Sp = spermatheca, SpD = spermathecal duct, SpS = spermathecal sac, SS = sensory seta, S8 = sternite 8, T8 = tergite 8, VA = ventral apodeme, VL = ventral lobe. Figure 9 modified from Metz et al, 2003.

subSubSection.paragraph: Thorax. Macrosetae 2–4 np, 1–2 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, 1–2 sc. Mesonotum with vittae dark brown, pruinescence light gray, separated by broad band of gray pruinescence; setae white to pink, appressed, lanceolate. Pleuron dark reddish brown, glossy on anterior threefourths of anepisternum, pruinescence silver, dense over remainder of pleuron. Wing. Length 4.0– 5.3 , 4.4 mm , length/width 3.0– 3.7 , 3.3 ; membrane opaque with broad pale brown margin along veins and crossveins; veins and pterostigma dark brown. Legs. Femora dark brown, pruinescence white; av 2–4 : 1 : 2–6 , pv 0: 0–1 : 1–2 . Tibiae brown, occasionally dark brown. Tarsi dark brown.

Abdomen. Cuticle black, glossy, tergite 5 with posterior band of gray pruinescence; dorsal setae dark reddish brown, appressed, tergites 1–4 with white setae across posterior margin.
Terminalia
. Furca (
Fig. 10
), length 0.38 mm , width 0.28 mm ; spermathecal sac long, broad, spermatheca spherical (
Fig. 10
).

Biology.
Nigranitida costata
has been hand netted or collected in Malaise traps in moist habitats or dry canyons from
15 September to 2 March
.

Specimens Examined .
Type Specimens.
The neotype female of
Psilocephala costata Wulp
was designated by
Metz (Metz et al. 2003
: 241 ) utilizing the holotype female of the
Psilocephala atra
Kröber ( 1911 : 512 )
, a junior synonym of
Nigranitida costa
(
Metz et al. 2003
: 239 ). This neotype (MEI
140761
) was collected in Poterillos [Potrerillos], Prov. Mendoza, Reimoser, Argentina and deposited in the NHMW . Other Specimens.
